timeline.bodyText: Where is this used?

@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@

+/**

timeline.bodyText: No need to specify V1 in this and DeploymentsMetrics
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: This endpoint is usable only on container nodes, and will return metrics for all nodes. Additionally, it will have a slightly different dimension set, so reusing getClusterInfoFromDimensions won't work.
timeline.author: olaaun

replies.bodyText: Changed to based on the /metrics/v2/values default path, should be correct for 1 node or all nodes.
replies.author: Oracien

timeline.bodyText: Instead of removing private, extract functions to separate class
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: Instead of JSONObject, return a ProtonMetrics object, which can do validation and aggregation
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: services is a list of JSON objects. You want the objects where the name field is vespa.searchnode
timeline.author: olaaun

replies.bodyText: made a recursive traverser, but it is highly inefficient
replies.author: Oracien

timeline.bodyText: Unused
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: I suggest splitting these into separate strings, making the addAll function more readable.
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText:
Two notes on this class:

An application can have more than one content cluster, so it'd be useful if these metrics are aggregated per cluster.
If I'm reading this right, the aggregation just sums the values. At least the percentage based metrics should be averaged instead
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.message: added unit tests and resources

timeline.bodyText: Use port 19092
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: It would be good to have a list of two hosts, each having different metric values. Then we would have some actual aggregation
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: This file can be shortened significantly. It's a sample response from a :4080/metrics/v2 call, which includes metrics from the irrelevant container and logserver nodes as well.
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: Unused
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText:
It's not really this class' responsibility to create HTTP responses, it does metric aggregation.
You can build the response directly in ApplicationApiHandler
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: What's the meaning behind this field?
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: Add unit test for this.
timeline.author: olaaun

timeline.bodyText: This is no longer a method of ConfigServer
timeline.author: olaaun
